title: Digital Economy Survey 2021

sections.title: Access to, and use of, the internet

groups.title: Access to, and use of, the internet

list: Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland unless otherwise stated.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.description: View the questions before starting the survey
This survey measures information about the digital economy, including e-commerce and use of technology.
What we mean by 'e-commerce'

E-commerce is the sale or purchase of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing orders, via a website, app or Electronic Data Interchange (EDI).
The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.
E-commerce transactions exclude orders made by manually typed email.

questions.question: Access to, and use of, the internet

content.description: In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

list: internet access
internet connection
use of a website, app and social media pages
use of digital marketing strategies

content.description: In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

list: turnover from e-commerce sales to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
types of customers located in the UK and outside the UK
types of goods and services sold via e-commerce to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
platforms used to make e-commerce sales to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
difficulties when selling to customers located in European Union Countries via a website or app
difficulties when selling via an online marketplace

content.description: For e-commerce sales to customers located outside the UK, you will also be asked to provide information on the value of turnover from sales by geographical area.
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

list: expenditure on e-commerce purchases from suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK
types of suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK from which e-commerce purchases were made
types of goods and services purchased via e-commerce from suppliers located in  the UK and outside the UK
types of platforms used to make e-commerce purchases from suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK

content.description: For e-commerce purchases from suppliers located outside the UK, you will also be asked to provide information on expenditure on purchases by geographical area.

questions.question: Foreign sales and purchases of digital services

content.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: turnover from sales of digitally delivered services to customers located outside the UK
expenditure on purchases of digitally delivered services to suppliers located outside the UK

content.description: Include e-commerce and non-e-commerce sales.

questions.question: Sales and purchases of digital and non-digital goods and services

content.description: In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

list: sales and purchases of digital goods and services
sales and purchases of non-digital goods and services
sales and purchases of digitally delivered services
sales of data and advertising space

content.description: In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

list: income received from fees charged by your business for providing digital intermediary platform services
value of goods sold through your platform
value of services sold through your platform
amount your business pays to a digital intermediary platform to sell your products

questions.question: Use of business software and cloud computing

content.description: In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

list: use of and expenditure on business software such as accountancy software, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software
any cloud computing services that your business uses over the internet

content.description: In this section, you will be asked to provide information on the analysis, sale and purchase of big data by your business.
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on use of and spend on ICT expertise or advice.
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

list: whether your business engaged in any digital activities
any additional actions required to ensure compliance with digital regulations
any difficulties experienced when ensuring compliance with digital regulations

content.description: In this section, you will be asked to provide information on your business's ICT security measures.
What we mean by 'ICT security'
This refers to measures, controls and procedures applied to ICT systems in order to ensure integrity, authenticity, availability and confidentiality of data and systems.

list: You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
The information you provide contributes to statistics on digital trade, business use of the internet and other technology.

blocks.title: Access to, and use of, the internet
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

  • internet access
  • internet connection
  • use of a website, app and social media pages
  • use of digital marketing strategies

questions.title: What percentage of people in {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} use computers with internet access for work?
questions.description: An informed estimate is acceptable.

content.description: Include:

list: employees, directors and proprietors
all agency staff on your payroll

content.description: Exclude:

list: agency staff not on your payroll

definitions.title: What we mean by 'computers'

content.description: Include:

list: personal computers
portable computers such as laptops, netbooks, notebooks and tablets
other portable devices such as smartphones and Personal Digital Assistants (PDAs)

content.description: Exclude:

list: terminals and computers solely used for Electronic Point of Sale (EPOS)

answers.label: Percentage of people using computers with internet access for work
answers.description: Provide percentages to one decimal place where possible

questions.title: You stated that the percentage of people using computers with internet access was {{ answers['answer87926dcf-c375-423c-8ddc-8c7667794476'] }}. Is that correct?

options.label: No, I need to change this
options.value: No, I need to change this

values: No, I need to change this

fibre optic technology (FTTP)
cable technology

search engine optimisation
web traffic analysis

blocks.title: E-commerce sales
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

  • turnover from e-commerce sales to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
  • types of customers located in the UK and outside the UK
  • types of goods and services sold via e-commerce to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
  • platforms used to make e-commerce sales to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
  • difficulties when selling to customers located in European Union Countries via a website or app
  • difficulties when selling via an online marketplace

For e-commerce sales to customers located outside the UK, you will also be asked to provide information on the value of turnover from sales by geographical area.

What we mean by 'e-commerce sales'

This refers to the sale of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving orders via a website, app or Electronic Data Interchange (EDI).

The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.

E-commerce transactions exclude orders made by manually typed email.

What we mean by 'website'

This refers to a collection of web pages arranged together to provide information or advice. It can consist of text, graphics, sound, video or a combination of these.

What we mean by 'app'

This refers to mobile applications usually downloaded from an app store onto a mobile phone, tablet or other device.

What we mean by 'Electronic Data Interchange (EDI)'

This refers to messages and information sent and received by electronic transmission methods and can be processed automatically, for example internet or non-internet EDI, XML and EDIFACT.

questions.title: During 2021, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} make any e-commerce sales?

content.description: Include:

list: reservations made online that resulted in making a sale
sales made to a parent or affiliate company not reported on this questionnaire
sales made via third-party websites and online marketplaces, for example Alibaba, Amazon, Amazon Business, Booking, eBay, Etsy and Rakuten

sales made via a digital intermediary platform. This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet, for example Facebook and YouTube

content.description: Exclude:

list: sales where the order was placed via manually typed email, telephone call or fax
items sold via self-service checkouts, such as in supermarkets
enquiries or reservations that did not result in making a sale

definitions.title: What we mean by 'e-commerce sales'

content.description: This refers to the sale of goods, services, materials or utilities conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing orders via a website, app or EDI.
The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.

options.label: No, we did not make e-commerce sales
options.value: No, we did not make e-commerce sales

values: No, we did not make e-commerce sales

questions.title: During 2021, which customers located in the UK did your business make e-commerce sales to?

answers.label: Select all that apply:

options.label: Private consumers (Business to Consumer [B2C])
options.description: This means any sale made to members of the general public located in the UK

options.label: Public authorities (Business to Government [B2G])
options.description: This means any sale made to central or local government authorities located in the UK such as HMRC, local councils, DVLA, public health services, public education bodies. Include sales made to Welsh Government, Scottish Government and Northern Ireland Executive

options.label: Other businesses (Business to Business [B2B])
options.description: This means any sale made by your business to another business located in the UK

blocks.title: E-commerce purchases
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

  • expenditure on e-commerce purchases from suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK
  • types of suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK from which e-commerce purchases were made
  • types of goods and services purchased via e-commerce from suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK
  • types of platforms used to make e-commerce purchases from suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK

For e-commerce purchases from suppliers located outside the UK, you will also be asked to provide information on expenditure on purchases by geographical area.

What we mean by 'e-commerce purchases'

This refers to the purchase of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of placing orders via a website, app or Electronic Data Interchange (EDI).

The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.

E-commerce transactions exclude orders made by manually typed email.

What we mean by 'website'

This refers to a collection of web pages arranged together to provide information or advice. It can consist of text, graphics, sound, video or a combination of these.

What we mean by 'app'

This refers to mobile applications usually downloaded from an app store onto a mobile phone, tablet or other device

What we mean by 'Electronic Data Interchange (EDI)'

This refers to messages and information sent and received by electronic transmission methods and can be processed automatically, for example internet or non-internet EDI, XML and EDIFACT.

questions.title: During 2021, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} make any e-commerce purchases?

content.description: Include:

list: reservations made online that resulted in making a purchase
purchases from a parent or affiliate company not reported on this questionnaire
purchases via third-party websites and online marketplaces, for example Alibaba, Amazon, Amazon Business, Booking, eBay, Etsy and Rakuten

purchases via a digital intermediary platform. This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet, for example Facebook and YouTube

content.description: Exclude:

list: purchases made by manually typed email, fax, automated telephone entry or telephone call
items purchased via self-service checkouts, such as in supermarkets
enquiries or reservations that did not result in making a purchase

definitions.title: What we mean by 'e-commerce purchases'

content.description: This refers to the purchase of goods, services, materials and utilities conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing orders via a website, app or EDI.
The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.

options.label: No, we did not make e-commerce purchases
options.value: No, we did not make e-commerce purchases

values: No, we did not make e-commerce purchases

content.description: Exclude VAT

sections.title: Foreign sales and purchases of digital services

groups.title: Foreign sales and purchases of digital services

blocks.title: Foreign sales and purchases of digital services
blocks.description:
In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

  • turnover from sales of digitally delivered services to customers located outside the UK
  • expenditure on purchases of digitally delivered services from suppliers located outside the UK

Include e-commerce and non e-commerce sales.

questions.title: During 2021, what was your business's turnover from the sale of digitally delivered services to customers located outside the UK?
questions.description: An informed estimate is acceptable.

content.description: Include:

list: e-commerce sales and non e-commerce sales

content.description: Exclude:

list: VAT

definitions.title: What we mean by 'digitally delivered services'

content.description: This refers to all services delivered in an electronic format, regardless of how they were ordered.
Examples of digitally delivered services:

list: insurance and financial services
consultancy services
computer services
marketing services
streaming music, films, television and radio
online games and e-books

answers.label: Turnover from sales of digitally delivered services to customers outside the UK
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

questions.title: During 2021, what was your business's expenditure on digitally delivered services from suppliers located outside the UK?
questions.description: An informed estimate is acceptable.

content.description: Include:

list: e-commerce and non e-commerce purchases

content.description: Exclude:

list: VAT

answers.label: Expenditure on digitally delivered services from suppliers located outside the UK
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

sections.title: Sales and purchases of digital and non-digital goods and services

groups.title: Sales and purchases of digital and non-digital goods and services

blocks.title: Sales and purchases of digital and non-digital goods and services
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

  • sales and purchases of digital goods and services
  • sales and purchases of non-digital goods and services
  • sales and purchases of digitally delivered services
  • sales of data and advertising space

questions.title: During 2021, what was {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s turnover from the sale of digital goods and services?
questions.description: An informed estimate is acceptable.

content.description: Include:

list: initial sale of digital goods and services
ongoing maintenance and upgrades of digital goods and services

definitions.title: What we mean by 'digital goods and services'

content.description: This refers to:

ICT goods: physical goods that will store, retrieve, manipulate, transmit or receive information electronically in a digital form. For example, computers and peripheral equipment, communication equipment, consumer electronic equipment and miscellaneous components.
Cloud computing services: the delivery of computing services, including servers, storage, databases, networking, software, analytics, and intelligence, over the internet.
Digital intermediary services: the service of providing information on, and successfully matching, two independent parties to a transaction via a digital platform in return for an explicit fee.

Other digital services: for example, manufacturing services for ICT equipment, business and productivity software and licensing services, information technology consultancy and services, telecommunications services, leasing or rental services for ICT equipment and other ICT services.

answers.label: Turnover from the sale of digital goods and services
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

questions.title: How much of the {{ format_currency(answers['answerd99ae7af-599d-44f6-b729-bdf86d9cd46e'], 'GBP') }} turnover from the sale of digital goods and services, came from the following?
questions.description:
An informed estimate is acceptable.

Values should sum to your business's turnover from the sale of digital goods and services.

content.description: Include:

list: initial sale of digital goods and services
ongoing maintenance and upgrades of digital goods and services

definitions.title: What we mean by 'digital goods and services'

content.description: This refers to:

ICT goods: physical goods that will store, retrieve, manipulate, transmit or receive information electronically in a digital form. For example, computers and peripheral equipment, communication equipment, consumer electronic equipment and miscellaneous components.
Cloud computing services: the delivery of computing services, including servers, storage, databases, networking, software, analytics, and intelligence, over the internet.
Digital intermediary services: the service of providing information on, and successfully matching, two independent parties to a transaction via a digital platform in return for an explicit fee.

Other digital services: for example, manufacturing services for ICT equipment, business and productivity software and licensing services, information technology consultancy and services, telecommunications services, leasing or rental services for ICT equipment and other ICT services.

answers.label: Turnover from the sale of ICT goods
Turnover from the sale of cloud services
Turnover from the sale of digital intermediary services
Turnover from the sale of other digital services
answers.description: Exclude cloud services

questions.title: During 2021, what was your business's turnover from the sale of digitally delivered services?
questions.description: An informed estimate is acceptable.

content.description: Include all sales of digitally delivered services, sold via any means. This includes e-commerce and non e-commerce sales.

definitions.title: What we mean by 'digitally delivered services'

content.description: This refers to services which are delivered in an electronically downloadable or streamable format.  Only the format of delivery needs to be digital, the order for the service could have been placed digitally or non-digitally.
Examples of digitally delivered services:

list: insurance and financial services
consultancy services
computer services
marketing services
streaming music, films, television and radio
online games and e-books

answers.label: Turnover from the sale of digitally delivered services
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

questions.title: During 2021, what was your business's turnover from the sale of non-digital goods and services?
questions.description: An informed estimate is acceptable.

content.description: Include:

list: all sales of non-digital goods, services, materials and utilities that are not delivered online

content.description: Exclude:

list: ICT goods. For example, computers and peripheral equipment, communication equipment, consumer electronic equipment and miscellaneous components
cloud goods and services
other digital goods and services

definitions.title: What we mean by 'non-digital goods and services'

content.description: This refers to goods and services that have a physical form, for example CDs and books, and goods and services not delivered online, for example face to face learning courses. It includes orders placed digitally and non-digitally.

answers.label: Value of turnover from the sale of non-digital goods and services
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

questions.title: During 2021, what was your business's turnover from the sale of data and advertising space?
questions.description: An informed estimate is acceptable.

definitions.title: What we mean by 'sale of data and advertising space'

content.description: This refers to turnover generated selling data or advertising space.
Turnover generated from the sale of data:

list: on social media
about your customers or service users
your business collects as part of business processes
about production processes, for example electricity used over a period of time

content.description: Turnover generated from the sale of advertising space on:

list: social media platforms
search engines
knowledge sharing platforms
apps
websites and platforms that direct visitors to third party websites

answers.label: Turnover from the sale of data and advertising space
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

Other digital services: for example, manufacturing services for ICT equipment, business and productivity software and licensing services, information technology consultancy and services, telecommunications services, leasing or rental services for ICT equipment, and other ICT services.

blocks.title: Digital intermediary platforms
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

  • income received from fees charged by your business for providing digital intermediary platform services
  • value of goods sold through your platform
  • value of services sold through your platform
  • amount your business pays to a digital intermediary platform to sell your products

What we mean by 'digital intermediary platforms'

  • This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet
  • A digital intermediary platform usually facilitates these interactions for a fee, but it could also be funded by advertisements
  • A digital intermediary platform does not typically own the goods or services, but has the facility for sellers to provide these, either in digital or physical form, via the platform
  • An online marketplace is a type of digital intermediary platform

Examples of digital intermediary platforms:

  • Facebook
  • Online marketplaces such as Amazon, Etsy and Rakuten
  • YouTube

questions.title: During 2021, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} provide a digital intermediary platform service?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'digital intermediary platform'

list: This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet
A digital intermediary platform usually facilitates these interactions for a fee, but it could also be funded by advertisements, for example YouTube or Facebook
A digital intermediary platform does not typically own the goods or services, but has the facility for sellers to provide these, either in digital or physical form, via the platform.
An online marketplace is a type of digital intermediary platform

content.description: Examples of digital intermediary platforms:

list: Facebook
Online marketplaces such as Amazon, Etsy and Rakuten
YouTube

options.label: Yes, we provided a digital intermediary platform service
options.value: Yes, we provided a digital intermediary platform service

options.label: No, we did not provide a digital intermediary platform service
options.value: No, we did not provide a digital intermediary platform service

values: No, we did not provide a digital intermediary platform service

questions.title: During 2021, what was your business's income from fees charged to the following users of your digital intermediary platform?
questions.description: Informed estimates are acceptable.

content.description: Include:

list: fees paid by users

content.description: Exclude:

list: the value of any goods or services sold through the platform

definitions.title: What we mean by 'users'

questions.title: During 2021, did your business pay a digital intermediary platform to sell your goods and services?

options.label: Yes, we paid a digital intermediary platform to sell our goods and services
options.value: Yes, we paid a digital intermediary platform to sell our goods and services

options.label: No, we did not pay a digital intermediary platform to sell our goods and services
options.value: No, we did not pay a digital intermediary platform to sell our goods and services

values: No, we did not pay a digital intermediary platform to sell our goods and services

questions.title: During 2021, how much did your business pay to a digital intermediary platform to sell your goods and services?
questions.description: An informed estimate is acceptable.

definitions.title: What we mean by 'digital intermediary platform'

list: This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet
A digital intermediary platform usually facilitates these interactions for a fee, but it could also be funded by advertisements, for example YouTube or Facebook
A digital intermediary does not typically own the goods or services, but has the facility for sellers to provide these, either in digital or physical form, via the platform
An online marketplace is a type of digital intermediary platform

content.description: Examples of digital intermediary platforms:

list: Facebook
Online marketplaces such as Amazon, Etsy and Rakuten
YouTube

answers.label: Amount paid to digital intermediary platforms to sell your goods and services
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

sections.title: Use of business software and cloud computing

groups.title: Use of business software and cloud computing

blocks.title: Use of business software and cloud computing
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

  • use of, and expenditure on, business software such as accountancy software, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software
  • any cloud computing services that your business uses over the internet

What we mean by 'cloud computing services'

This refers to services used over the internet, including connections via Virtual Private Networks (VPN) to access software, computing power and storage capacity.

Cloud computing services:

  • are delivered from servers of service providers
  • can be used as an on-demand self-service, at least after set up, without human interaction with a service provider
  • can be scaled up or down, for example for a change in number of users or storage capacity
  • are paid by use or per capacity used, or they are prepaid

questions.title: Does {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} use any of the following software?

answers.label: Select all that apply

options.label: Accountancy software
options.description: Exclude cloud based accountancy software

options.label: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software
options.description: This refers to any software application for managing information about customers. Exclude cloud based CRM software

options.label: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software
options.description: A software package used to manage resources by sharing information among different functional areas, for example, accounting, planning, production and marketing. Include both cloud and non-cloud based ERP software

options.label: None of the business software specified in this list
options.value: None of the business software specified in this list

questions.title: During 2021, what was your business's expenditure on software?
questions.description: Informed estimates are acceptable.

content.description: Include:

list: initial purchase of software
purchase of licences for software
recurring subscription costs
ongoing maintenance and upgrades

content.description: Exclude:

list: purchases of physical hardware

answers.label: Expenditure on software
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

blocks.title: Big data
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on the analysis, sale and purchase of big data by your business.

What we mean by 'big data'

This refers to large data sets that are generated from electronic activities and from machine-to-machine communications, for example, from social media or production processes.

Characteristics of big data:

  • vast amounts of data generated over time
  • variety in terms of different formats of complex data, either structured or unstructured, for example text, video, images, voice, documents, sensor data, activity logs, click streams, coordinates
  • velocity in terms of the high speed at which data are generated, become available and change over time

questions.title: During 2021, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} analyse big data from any of the following sources?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'analyse big data'

content.description: This refers to the study of large data sets that are generated from electronic activities and from machine-to-machine communications, for example, from social media or production processes. It refers to techniques, technologies and software tools for analysing large data sets from your own business or other data sources.

answers.label: Select all that apply:

options.label: The business's own data from smart devices or sensors
options.value: The business's own data from smart devices or sensors
options.description: For example, Machine to Machine (M2M) communications, digital sensors, RFID tags

options.label: Geolocation data from the use of portable devices
options.value: Geolocation data from the use of portable devices
options.description: For example, portable devices using mobile telephone networks, wireless connections or GPS

options.label: Data generated from social media
options.description: For example, social networks, blogs, multimedia content sharing websites

options.label: Other big data sources not specified in this list
options.value: Other big data sources not specified in this list

options.label: We did not analyse big data
options.value: We did not analyse big data

values: We did not analyse big data

questions.title: Which of the following methods did your business use to analyse big data?

answers.label: Select all that apply:

options.label: Machine learning
options.description: For example, deep learning, which involves 'training' a computer model to better perform an automated task

options.label: Natural language processing, natural language generation or speech recognition
options.value: Natural language processing, natural language generation or speech recognition
options.description: This is the ability of a computer program to understand human language as it is spoken and convert it to machine-readable format

options.label: Other methods of big data analysis
options.value: Other methods of big data analysis

blocks.title: ICT support
blocks.description: In this section, you will be asked to provide information on use of and spend on ICT expertise or advice.

questions.title: During 2021, who mainly performed the ICT or IT functions of your business?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'ICT or IT'

content.description: ICT refers to Information Communication Technology and means any technology associated with communication.
IT refers to Information Technology and means technology associated with computers, software and networks.

options.label: Own employees
options.description: This includes those employed in parent or affiliate businesses

questions.title: During 2021, what was your business's expenditure on external ICT support?

content.description: Exclude ICT or IT support provided by anyone on your payroll

definitions.title: What we mean by 'external ICT support'

content.description: This refers to ICT or IT specialist support for developing, operating or maintaining ICT or IT systems or applications. The support must have been provided externally, for a fee, by anyone not on your payroll.
Examples of ICT or IT systems and applications:

list: cloud services
backup and disaster recovery
network security
help desk support
managed print services
computer training
IT consulting

content.description: ICT refers to Information Communication Technology and means any technology associated with communication.
IT refers to Information Technology and means technology associated with computers, software and networks.

answers.label: Expenditure on external ICT support
answers.description: Enter a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for £56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

blocks.title: Digital activities
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on:

  • whether your business engaged in any digital activities
  • any additional actions required to ensure compliance with digital regulations
  • any difficulties experienced when ensuring compliance with digital regulations

Examples of digital activities:

  • having a website
  • making e-commerce sales
  • using social media
  • using computer programming
  • using information sharing software

Examples of digital regulations:

  • data protection regulations
  • competition law
  • platform to business regulation

questions.title: During 2021, did {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} engage in any digital activities?

definitions.title: Examples of digital activities

list: having a website
making e-commerce sales
using social media
using computer programming
using information sharing software

options.label: Yes, we engaged in digital activities
options.value: Yes, we engaged in digital activities

options.label: No, we did not engage in any digital activities
options.value: No, we did not engage in any digital activities

values: No, we did not engage in any digital activities

questions.title: When engaging in digital activities, did your business need to take any of the following actions to ensure compliance to regulations?

list: data protection regulations
competition law
platform to business regulation

blocks.title: ICT security
blocks.description:
In this section, you will be asked to provide information on your business's ICT security measures.

What we mean by 'ICT security'

This refers to measures, controls and procedures applied to ICT systems in order to ensure integrity, authenticity, availability and confidentiality of data and systems.

questions.title: Does {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} use any of the following ICT security measures?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'ICT security'

content.description: This refers to measures, controls and procedures applied to ICT systems in order to ensure integrity, authenticity, availability and confidentiality of data and systems.

answers.label: Select all that apply:

options.label: Access control to business network
options.description: For example, management of user access rights

options.label: Encryption techniques for data, documents or email
options.value: Encryption techniques for data, documents or email

options.label: ICT risk assessment
options.description: For example, periodic assessment of probability and consequences of ICT security incidents

options.label: ICT security tests
options.description: For example, performing penetration tests, review of security measures,  testing of back-up systems and testing security alert system

options.label: Keeping software and operating systems updated
options.value: Keeping software and operating systems updated

options.label: Offsite data back-up
options.description: For example, physical or electronic back-up including the cloud

options.label: Strong password authentication
options.description: For example, a minimum length of 8 mixed alpha and numeric characters with periodic change

options.label: User identification and authentication via biometric methods
options.value: User identification and authentication via biometric methods
options.description: For example, faces, fingerprints and voices

options.label: Virtual Private Network (VPN)
options.description: This extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network

options.label: None of the security measures specified in this list
options.value: None of the security measures specified in this list

questions.title: Please provide any further details that will help us understand your answers and tell an industry story
questions.description: Explain any significant changes to {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s e-commerce sales and your use of Information and Communication Technology (ICT). If you provide comments, we are less likley to contact you with data queries.
